meanings.definition: To cause harm or damage to (something)
meanings.sent1: The storm was blighting the crops in the field.
meanings.sent2: The disease was slowly blighting the beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was blighting the picnic by stealing all the food.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments were blighting her self-confidence like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The relentless sun was blighting the delicate flowers, wilting them away.

meanings.definition: Something that spoils or damages something else
meanings.sent1: The factory pollution was a blighting on the once clear river.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned building stood as a blighting on the neighborhood's appearance.
meanings.sent3: The noisy construction site was a blighting on his peaceful afternoon nap.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti-covered walls were a blighting on the city's beauty.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise from the highway was a blighting on the tranquility of the countryside.
